definition: to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions

sentences.english: New method of the transfer of the Housing Fund.
sentences.chinese: 改变支取资金的划转方式。

sentences.english: I want to withdraw 200 dollars from my  deposit account.
sentences.chinese: 我要从我的定期存款中支取200美圆。

sentences.english: The deposit amount is set by the depositor and the accrued interests are paid by installment.
sentences.chinese: 存款金额由储户自定，分期支取本息。

sentences.english: Withdrawing with cipher, free deposit & withdrawal; account settlement.
sentences.chinese: 凭密码支取，通存通兑，结算账户。

sentences.english: I'd like to withdraw two hundred dollars from my account.
sentences.chinese: 我想从我的帐户支取两百美元。

sentences.english: Generally cash advances do not have an interest free period.
sentences.chinese: 通常提前支取现金不享受免息期。

sentences.english: The savings office will issue a deposit certificate（passbook） to you and you will be paid the principal in a lump sum when the deposit is due.
sentences.chinese: 由储蓄机构发给存款凭证，到期一次支取本金。

sentences.english: In reimbursement， please drawn on our Head Office account with your London office。
sentences.chinese: 请从我总行在贵行伦敦分行的账户内支取。

sentences.english: Will the money that has been put aside actually be there when people will need to draw upon it," Sin adds.
sentences.chinese: 当人们需要支取养老金时，专项资金是否实际存在。

sentences.english: Banking and credit card information is stored and accessed by computers.
sentences.chinese: 银行业务及信用卡的资料都要靠计算机储存和支取。

sentences.english: For withdrawal by seal, please affix the seal at the designated place.
sentences.chinese: 凭印签支取的，请在指定位置加盖预留印签。

definition: to deposit (e.g. in a bank account)
to withdraw money/to take money out of the bank
to get an advance on one's pay
to pay in advance/to get payment in advance
